ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: ANTH 471 is disorganized, has poor communication between the department and students, and left students confused about requirements and criteria throughout the term. A big responsibility of structure of course resides between the student and the student's specific advisor, but the department also has a responsibility in providing effective oversight of ANTH 471. There is no structure or guidance throughout the process, and while I see minimal formal structure as a beneficial approach since too much formal structure can be overbearing, the lack of any structure whatsoever was very frustrating.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
